bug.description:
I am getting a segmentation fault when I run this in python3.5 <denchmark-code>df = pd.read_csv('covertype-small.csv') labels = df['label'] dataset = df.drop('label', 1) output = mlpack.preprocess_split(input=dataset, input_labels=labels, test_ratio=0.1) </denchmark-code>
but on removing input_labels, it works fine. output = mlpack.preprocess_split(input=dataset, test_ratio=0.1) I built mlpack-3.0.4 from source on Ubuntu 16.04 Armadillo version: 6.5 Please suggest how to find out the issue.

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bhavya01>@bhavya01</denchmark-link> . I think it will work. <denchmark-code>df = pd.read_csv('covertype-small.csv') labels = pd.DataFrame(data=df['label']) dataset = df.drop('label', 1) output = mlpack.preprocess_split(input=dataset, input_labels=labels, test_ratio=0.1) </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/KimSangYeon-DGU>@KimSangYeon-DGU</denchmark-link> : nice workaround, thanks! <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bhavya01>@bhavya01</denchmark-link> : I can reproduce this also, and I agree that it is a bug. But can I ask why you did not use the 'bug report' issue template? It makes it a lot easier for us... If anyone wants to look into this (it may be a while until I can get to it), I am willing to bet that the issue will be in the to_matrix() function found in src/mlpack/bindings/python/mlpack/matrix_utils.py. In the code snippet, labels is of type pandas.core.series.Series, so I guess that we are not handling this case correctly.
Sorry, I wasn't sure if this was a bug or a problem in my installation. I would like to look into it.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/bhavya01>@bhavya01</denchmark-link> sounds good. Maybe we can update the issue template to use the word "problem" instead. If you want to look into it, feel free---my suggestion would be to take a look through the file matrix_utils.py that I mentioned, and maybe add some print() lines to see which paths are being taken through the code, to see what is being passed to mlpack. You can also try to debug from the C++ side, by compiling mlpack with debug options (cmake -DDEBUG=ON ...), and then using gdb python and entering the code that fails, and figuring out what has happened at the site of the segfault.
